visualization_prompt: Generate a line chart showing negative to positive value spectrum using a logarithmic color axis with custom negative value conversion

title.text: Logarithmic Color Axis with Negative Value Spectrum

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains univariate quantitative measurements spanning 11 ordered categories, demonstrating exponential magnitude progression from -1000 to +1000. Manually constructed values exhibit symmetric log distribution around zero with 10^x spacing, testing color axis boundary conditions. Data validity derives from mathematical progression rather than empirical sources, maintaining strict log-linear relationships for technical demonstration. The line chart format maximizes data-ink ratio by directly encoding magnitude through both position and chromatic intensity. Dual visual channels (vertical position + color gradient) follow Cairo's principles of multivariate encoding, while the symmetric diverging color scheme enhances magnitude comparison. Logarithmic compression (base 10) with μ=0 and σ≈577 preserves relative differences across six orders of magnitude. Custom axis extension enables negative value visualization through mathematical transformation while maintaining perceptual linearity in color progression.
